meanings.definition: A choral ode in Greek tragedy typically performed by the chorus after the entrance of the actors.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the chorus sang a stasima that expressed their emotions.
meanings.sent2: The stasima added a beautiful musical element to the tragic performance.
meanings.sent3: The stasima had the audience tapping their feet to the rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The stasima echoed through the theater, filling the air with haunting melodies.
meanings.sent5: The stasima resonated in the hearts of all who listened, leaving a lasting impact.

meanings.sent1: The statue stood in a stasima at the center of the garden.
meanings.sent2: She held her breath, frozen in a stasima of anticipation.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy stasima on the windowsill to watch the birds.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stand still, trapped in a stasima of silence.
meanings.sent5: The old clock on the wall ticked away, marking each moment in its stasima.
